item.title: The What and Why of My Blog
item.description: The What Like there are many ways up a mountain, there are many ways to get into research. Becoming a balanced researcher, however, requires proficiency in many skills, some of which may not have been necessary in one’s previous work. Academic writing is an essential skill for research. I went to engineering school and then industry, neither of which involved writing research articles (or much writing in general). I am going to investigate what aspects of writing constitute the polish expected at top-tier conferences.

item.title: Misc
item.description: A few of my (current) favorite things I have few lifetime favorites, but I always have a lot of recent favorites. Here are some: book: To the Lighthouse (Virginia Woolf had an amazing understanding of the diversity of human perspective) song: thank u, next (I love Ari) movie: Suspiria (2018) (kidding, couldn’t even watch the whole thing) exercise: Bulgarian Split Squat (great for someone like me who has underdeveloped hamstrings)

item.title: About
item.description: Welcome web traveler! I’m a master’s student at Johns Hopkins University in the Center for Language and Speech Processing and the Human Language Technology Center of Excellence (HLTCOE). I am generously supported through a research assistantship by my advisor, Ben Van Durme. I am interested in machine learning and natural language processing.
